issues.description: The Part 2 description in the problem statement erroneously says that each PersonController method takes a Consumer<List<Note>>, but both the UML diagram and the template code use Consumer<List<Person>>. This mismatch between the described parameter type and the actual expected type can confuse students about which generic type to use.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the problem statement text to refer to Consumer<List<Person>> instead of Consumer<List<Note>> for the PersonController methods.
